05 Aug 2011

Hello from Hypenotic’s newest old employee

By in category

Hi! I’m Sonja, a designer here at Hypenotic. No, not the lovely Sonya B. who, as you may know, was art director here for many years. A different Sonja. With a ‘j’.

I’m writing this post to introduce myself. Funny thing is, I’m not really new. I started here last spring with a three week internship. Then, I became the intern that just wouldn’t leave. After my three weeks were up, I stuck around for the summer, and then part time throughout the school year. Finally, I graduated from uni and I thought, well they’ve gotten used to me hanging around, might as well grace them with my presence every day! So, starting three weeks ago, I officially work here full-time. I am Hypenotic’s newest (but not really) employee, here for all your identity/promotional material/wire-framing/package design/misc. needs. I’ll take on pretty much any task you can throw my way.

So what is there to know about me?

Home sweet home.

I hail from an acreage in rural Saskatchewan, near the little town of Turtleford, population 505 (and home of Ernie, Canada’s largest turtle). With the exception of a few years in Latvia, Poland, and England, I spent most of my life out in the country. Somehow, moving to downtown Toronto wasn’t that much of a culture shock for me. There’s just a few minor differences. Instead of looking out my window to see fields and forests, I  see dumpsters and one lone tree. Instead of hearing coyotes howling at night, I hear sirens. Instead of being surrounded by nature, I’m surrounded by high-rises, busy streets, and SO MANY PEOPLE (But, there are lots of raccoons here! That counts as nature, right?). I don’t know every single person living in Toronto, and they don’t know me.

Despite the differences, Toronto has become my second home and I’ve grown to love it here.

Other things about me

Like

Cats. Traveling to new places. Vintage dresses. Costume parties. Nice paper.

Dislike

Low-fat cream cheese. People who walk too slow. When people write “your” instead of “you’re”.

Scared of

Blogging (I’m overcoming my fears today, yay!). Bed bugs. Zombies. Saying the wrong thing.

Known for

Being a crazy cat lady (I usually think cats are cuter than babies). Being borderline narcoleptic (I can and do fall asleep anytime, anywhere).

Weird little facts

I love to clean. It’s just so satisfying! Arranging food in the fridge is like a recreational activity.
I like the smell of burnt matches. Also,  a toilet cleaner called Toilet Duck. I don’t know why.
My guilty pleasure is watching Jersey Shore. I’m ashamed, and I’m sorry.
I wrote a love song when I was seven years old. I can still remember most of the lyrics. It’s hilarious. But you will never, ever hear me sing it.

Well, that’s me! Now here I am; fresh out of university, ready to experience life out in the real world, and very excited to be Hypenotic’s newest old employee.

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
